page.title: 02E. CHARMINSTER - HOUSING 1
page.content: The area is very sparsely populated, and the majority of buildings are connected with farming. In the main, cottages and farms have retained their character. Flint and brick banding can be seen on older farmhouses, but there are also one or two more modern buildings. A thatched house, an old toll cottage on the Old Sherborne Road, plus the slate roofed farm cottages of red brick ensure that the presence of architecture in the landscape remains a delightful blending of styles rather than the intrusive eyesores so often encountered in an otherwise beautiful rural area. Sadly, some farm cottages are showing signs of neglect. Modern machinery has meant a reduction in the number of farm workers, and their accommodation is no longer required.
